SENT.plain: On the basis of a pathomorphological and biochemical study of 22 cases with focal hemorrhages in atherosclerosis the author detected a contraction of nerve cells, adipose infiltration, "shadow-cells", a deposit of ferrum in the cytoplasma
The swelling of myelinic fibres was detected more often than hypermyelinization, fragmentation and demyelinization
Glia changes consisted in ameboid transformation and clasmatodendrosis
The maximum increase of the cholesterin amount was observed in pons varoli
Medulla oblongata and dentate nucleus and the minimum--in the cerebellar cortex and cerebrum hemispheres
The subcortical modes according to cholesterin growth and amount occupy the middle place
The connected cholesterin makes up 2/3 of the general amount
